page.title: 02Catterick Village
page.content: {Catterick Village}lies to the south of the River Swale,and to the east of the main A1 road.{The Great North Road once went through Catterick Village, and since the Catterick Bypass was built heavy traffic is kept well clear of the village.In 1984 the roundabouts on the A1 were removed and replaced by slip roads and flyovers,this has helped to ease traffic flow problems. The area has Roman connections and is a rich source of local history. There are old stone cottages bordering Low Green and on the Low Green are some of the oldest trees in Catterick. According to the{1981 Census,}the population of Catterick was{2,709. In the village there is a selection of amenities including shops,hotels and cafes, a health centre,a garage and a primary school.
